text: In 1844, the United States chose James Polk over Martin Van Buren in the 1844 presidential election. People thought that Van Buren believed in dictatorship and was not fair, especially with Mexico.http://filsonhistorical.org/vcc/subject/?n=Van+Buren%2C+Martin%2C+1782-1862 People were also on Polk's side because he had a good sense of leadership, was fair with everyone, and tried to ignore Mexico when he had nothing to do with them. == References == Category:1844 1844 Category:1840s in the United States
title: 1844 United States presidential election
